alert.note: Alert for Eastern Magic Valley; Southern Hills, Albion Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 4:02PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cassia County through 445 PM MDT... At 400 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles west of Oakley Reservoir, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain, wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated and Jackpot Fire Department. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oakley Reservoir, Oakley and Bostetter Ranger Station. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Jackpot Fire Department in Nevada reported a funnel cloud that has since dissipated but the overall storm structure continues to rotate.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Magic Valley; Southern Hills, Albion Mountains
